detailed_results.original_question: X Corp, a labor organization operating out of California, has recently taken control of its Texas-based branch due to alleged irregularities in financial management. This decision was made by the executive board following a formal meeting. However, there is unrest among members of the Texas branch who are questioning the legitimacy of this takeover. In this context, what is the core legal issue concerning X Corp's intervention?
options: The legality of imposing a trusteeship over a subordinate body.
The method of selecting the executive board of X Corp.
The financial reporting obligations of X Corp under the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act.
The personal liabilities of the officers of X Corp.
detailed_results.reference: US - Code of Federal Regulations Title 29 Labor Volume Subtitle B Regulations Relating to Labor
